intro: Braunsia bina, commonly known as the silverleaf braunsia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family. The plant is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves that are covered in a fine layer of white, powdery wax, giving it a silvery appearance. Its flowers are small, star-shaped, and typically pale yellow or white, blooming in late summer. Braunsia bina is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and ability to thrive in arid conditions.
